title: BGM2Pose: Active 3D Human Pose Estimation with Non-Stationary Sounds
author: Yusuke Oumi (Keio University), Yoshimitsu Aoki (Keio University), Go Irie (Tokyo University of Science), Mariko Isogawa (Keio University, JST Presto), ...
relevance_why: The paper's focus on acoustic-based human pose estimation can inform methodologies for audio signal processing and enhancement, relevant to Haohe Liu's work in music source separation and audio quality enhancement.
background: Estimating 3D human poses using common background music as non-invasive active sensing signals.
contribution: BGM2Pose introduces a framework that uses standard background music for 3D human pose estimation, achieving significantly better accuracy than prior methods using intrusive chirp signals.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied on chirp signals that are uncomfortable and impractical for continuous use in everyday environments.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by effectively leveraging background music, thus enhancing user comfort while maintaining robust pose accuracy.

key_innovation: Integrates a Contrastive Pose Extraction Module and a Frequency-wise Attention Module to isolate pose information amidst the dynamic changes of the background music.
real_world_impact: The approach holds promise for real-world applications in environments where traditional video recording is unfeasible or intrusive, due to its potential for comfort and unobtrusiveness.
limitations: The system requires subjects to be in line of sight of speakers and microphones, which can limit its application in varied real-world settings.

new_terms.Contrastive Pose Extraction Module: **Contrastive Pose Extraction Module** is a novel component that utilizes contrastive learning techniques to isolate the acoustic signals related to human poses from background sounds.
new_terms.Frequency-wise Attention Module: **Frequency-wise Attention Module** is an advanced component that dynamically identifies the relevant frequency bands in the audio signal that correspond to human movement for improved pose estimation.

open_sourcing: The datasets and code will be made publicly available.
